an4.90:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.90:1.3.eng: The confirmed ascetic, the white lotus ascetic, the pink lotus ascetic, and the delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.90:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a confirmed ascetic?

an4.90:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sekho hoti appattamānaso, anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamāno viharati.
an4.90:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant is a trainee who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire, but lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

an4.90:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇamacalo hoti.
an4.90:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a confirmed ascetic.

an4.90:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a white lotus ascetic?

an4.90:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassī viharati:
an4.90:3.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing rise and fall in the five grasping aggregates.

an4.90:3.3.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
an4.90:3.3.eng: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

an4.90:3.7.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti;
an4.90:3.7.eng: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’

an4.90:3.8.pli: no ca kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.90:3.8.eng: But they don’t have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.90:3.9.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapuṇḍarīko hoti.
an4.90:3.9.eng: That’s how an individual is a white lotus ascetic.

an4.90:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a pink lotus ascetic?

an4.90:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassī viharati:
an4.90:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing rise and fall in the five grasping aggregates.

an4.90:4.3.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
an4.90:4.3.eng: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

an4.90:4.7.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti;
an4.90:4.7.eng: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’

an4.90:4.8.pli: aṭṭha ca vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.90:4.8.eng: And they have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.90:4.9.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapadumo hoti.
an4.90:4.9.eng: That’s how an individual is a pink lotus ascetic.

an4.90:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti?
an4.90:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a delicate ascetic of ascetics?

an4.90:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yācitova bahulaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito …pe… mameva taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti.
an4.90:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant usually uses only what they’ve been invited to accept … And if anyone should be rightly called a delicate ascetic of ascetics, it’s me.

an4.90:5.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.90:5.3.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.91:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.91:1.5.eng: a god surrounded by titans, and

an4.91:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo asuro hoti asuraparivāro?
an4.91:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a titan surrounded by titans?

an4.91:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo, parisāpissa hoti dussīlā pāpadhammā.
an4.91:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is unethical, of bad character, and their followers are the same.

an4.91:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo asuro hoti asuraparivāro.
an4.91:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a titan surrounded by titans.

an4.91:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo asuro hoti devaparivāro?
an4.91:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a titan surrounded by gods?

an4.91:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo, parisā ca khvassa hoti sīlavatī kalyāṇadhammā.
an4.91:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is unethical, of bad character, but their followers are ethical, of good character.

an4.91:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo asuro hoti devaparivāro.
an4.91:3.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a titan surrounded by gods.

an4.91:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo devo hoti asuraparivāro?
an4.91:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a god surrounded by titans?

an4.91:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo, parisā ca khvassa hoti dussīlā pāpadhammā.
an4.91:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is ethical, of good character, but their followers are unethical, of bad character.

an4.91:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo devo hoti asuraparivāro.
an4.91:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a god surrounded by titans.

an4.91:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo devo hoti devaparivāro?
an4.91:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a god surrounded by gods?

an4.91:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo, parisāpissa hoti sīlavatī kalyāṇadhammā.
an4.91:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is ethical, of good character, and their followers are the same.

an4.91:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo devo hoti, devaparivāro.
an4.91:5.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a god surrounded by gods.

an4.91:5.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.91:5.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.92:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.92:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.3.eng: One individual has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.92:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
an4.92:1.4.eng: One individual has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.92:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.5.eng: One individual has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.92:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.92:1.6.eng: One individual has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.92:1.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.92:1.7.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.93:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.93:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.3.eng: One individual has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
an4.93:1.4.eng: One individual has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.93:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.5.eng: One individual has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:1.6.eng: One individual has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.93:2.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena ajjhattaṃ cetosamathe patiṭṭhāya adhipaññādhammavipassanāya yogo karaṇīyo.
an4.93:2.1.eng: As for the individual who has serenity but not discernment: grounded on serenity, they should practice meditation to get discernment.

an4.93:2.2.pli: So aparena samayena lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:2.2.eng: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.

an4.93:3.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena adhipaññādhammavipassanāya patiṭṭhāya ajjhattaṃ cetosamathe yogo karaṇīyo.
an4.93:3.1.eng: As for the individual who has discernment but not serenity: grounded on discernment, they should practice meditation to get serenity.

an4.93:3.2.pli: So aparena samayena lābhī ceva hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya lābhī ca ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
an4.93:3.2.eng: After some time they have both discernment and serenity.

an4.93:4.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo na ceva lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena tesaṃyeva kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭilābhāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
an4.93:4.1.eng: As for the individual who has neither serenity nor discernment: in order to get those skillful qualities, they should apply extraordinary enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

an4.93:4.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ādittacelo vā ādittasīso vā tasseva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañca vāyāmañca ussāhañca ussoḷhiñca appaṭivāniñca satiñca sampajaññañca kareyya;
an4.93:4.2.eng: Suppose your clothes or head were on fire. In order to extinguish it, you’d apply extraordinary enthusiasm, effort, zeal, vigor, perseverance, mindfulness, and situational awareness.

an4.93:4.3.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tena puggalena tesaṃyeva kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭilābhāya adhimatto chando ca vāyāmo ca ussāho ca ussoḷhī ca appaṭivānī ca sati ca sampajaññañca karaṇīyaṃ.
an4.93:4.3.eng: In the same way, in order to get those skillful qualities, that individual should apply extraordinary enthusiasm …

an4.93:4.4.pli: So aparena samayena lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.93:4.4.eng: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.

an4.93:5.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena tesuyeva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo.
an4.93:5.1.eng: As for the individual who has both serenity and discernment: grounded on those skillful qualities, they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.

an4.93:5.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.93:5.2.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.94:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.94:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.3.eng: One individual has internal serenity of heart, but not the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:1.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
an4.94:1.4.eng: One individual has the higher wisdom of discernment of principles, but not internal serenity of heart.

an4.94:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na ceva lābhī hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.5.eng: One individual has neither internal serenity of heart, nor the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:1.6.eng: One individual has both internal serenity of heart, and the higher wisdom of discernment of principles.

an4.94:2.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya so upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo:
an4.94:2.1.eng: As for the individual who has serenity but not discernment: they should approach someone who has discernment and ask:

an4.94:2.5.eng: They would answer from their own experience:

an4.94:2.6.pli: ‘evaṃ kho, āvuso, saṅkhārā daṭṭhabbā, evaṃ saṅkhārā sammasitabbā, evaṃ saṅkhārā vipassitabbā’ti.
an4.94:2.6.eng: ‘This is how conditions should be seen, comprehended, and discerned.’

an4.94:2.7.pli: So aparena samayena lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:2.7.eng: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.

an4.94:3.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya na lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa so upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo:
an4.94:3.1.eng: As for the individual who has discernment but not serenity: they should approach someone who has serenity and ask:

an4.94:3.2.eng: ‘Reverend, how should the mind be stilled?

an4.94:3.5.eng: How should it be immersed in samādhi?’

an4.94:3.6.eng: They would answer from their own experience:

an4.94:3.7.pli: ‘evaṃ kho, āvuso, cittaṃ saṇṭhapetabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ sannisādetabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ ekodi kātabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ samādahātabban’ti.
an4.94:3.7.eng: ‘Reverend, this is how the mind should be stilled, settled, unified, and immersed in samādhi.’

an4.94:3.8.pli: So aparena samaye lābhī ceva hoti adhipaññādhammavipassanāya lābhī ca ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa.
an4.94:3.8.eng: After some time they have both discernment and serenity.

an4.94:4.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo na ceva lābhī ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa na ca lābhī adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī ceva ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya so upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo:
an4.94:4.1.eng: As for the individual who has neither serenity nor discernment: they should approach someone who has serenity and discernment and ask:

an4.94:4.2.eng: ‘Reverend, how should the mind be stilled?

an4.94:4.5.eng: How should it be immersed in samādhi?’

an4.94:4.9.eng: They would answer as they’ve seen and known:

an4.94:4.10.pli: ‘evaṃ kho, āvuso, cittaṃ saṇṭhapetabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ sannisādetabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ ekodi kātabbaṃ, evaṃ cittaṃ samādahātabbaṃ, evaṃ saṅkhārā daṭṭhabbā, evaṃ saṅkhārā sammasitabbā, evaṃ saṅkhārā vipassitabbā’ti.
an4.94:4.10.eng: ‘Reverend, this is how the mind should be stilled, settled, unified, and immersed in samādhi. And this is how conditions should be seen, comprehended, and discerned.’

an4.94:4.11.pli: So aparena samayena lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.
an4.94:4.11.eng: After some time they have both serenity and discernment.

an4.94:5.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo lābhī ceva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya, tena, bhikkhave, puggalena tesu ceva kusalesu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya uttari āsavānaṃ khayāya yogo karaṇīyo.
an4.94:5.1.eng: As for the individual who has both serenity and discernment: grounded on those skillful qualities, they should practice meditation further to end the defilements.

an4.94:5.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.94:5.2.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.95:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.95:1.3.eng: One who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others;

an4.95:1.4.eng: one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;

an4.95:1.5.eng: one who practices to benefit themselves, but not others; and

an4.95:1.6.eng: one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.95:2.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, chavālātaṃ ubhato padittaṃ, majjhe gūthagataṃ, neva gāme kaṭṭhatthaṃ pharati na araññe (…);
an4.95:2.1.eng: Suppose there was a firebrand for lighting a funeral pyre, burning at both ends, and smeared with dung in the middle. It couldn’t be used as timber either in the village or the wilderness.

an4.95:2.2.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi yvāyaṃ puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya.
an4.95:2.2.eng: The individual who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others is like this, I say.

an4.95:3.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno no attahitāya, ayaṃ imesaṃ dvinnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
an4.95:3.1.eng: The individual who practices to benefit others, but not themselves, is better than that.

an4.95:3.2.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya, ayaṃ imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
an4.95:3.2.eng: The individual who practices to benefit themselves, but not others, is better than both of those.

an4.95:3.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno parahitāya ca, ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca pāmokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
an4.95:3.3.eng: But the individual who practices to benefit both themselves and others is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the four.

an4.95:4.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo, sappimaṇḍo tattha aggamakkhāyati;
an4.95:4.1.eng: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.

an4.95:4.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno parahitāya ca, ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca pāmokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
an4.95:4.2.eng: In the same way, the individual who practices to benefit both themselves and others is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the four.

an4.95:4.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.95:4.3.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.96:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.96:1.3.eng: One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;

an4.96:1.4.eng: one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;

an4.96:1.5.eng: one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and

an4.96:1.6.eng: one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.96:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya?
an4.96:2.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit themselves, but not others?

an4.96:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
an4.96:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual practices to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, but doesn’t encourage others to do the same.

an4.96:2.3.pli: attanā dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;

an4.96:2.4.pli: attanā mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.

an4.96:2.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.96:2.5.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit themselves, but not others.

an4.96:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya?
an4.96:3.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit others, but not themselves?

an4.96:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā na rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
an4.96:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t practice to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, but encourages others to remove theirs.

an4.96:3.3.pli: attanā na dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;

an4.96:3.4.pli: attanā na mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.

an4.96:3.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
an4.96:3.5.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit others, but not themselves.

an4.96:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
an4.96:4.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?

an4.96:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā na rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
an4.96:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t practice to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, nor do they encourage others to remove theirs.

an4.96:4.3.pli: attanā na dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;

an4.96:4.4.pli: attanā na mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.

an4.96:4.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.96:4.5.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.

an4.96:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca?
an4.96:5.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit both themselves and others?

an4.96:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā ca rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
an4.96:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual practices to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, and encourages others to remove theirs.

an4.96:5.3.pli: attanā ca dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca dosavinayāya samādapeti;

an4.96:5.4.pli: attanā ca mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca mohavinayāya samādapeti.

an4.96:5.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca.
an4.96:5.5.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.96:5.6.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.96:5.6.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.97:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.97:1.3.eng: One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;

an4.97:1.4.eng: one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;

an4.97:1.5.eng: one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and

an4.97:1.6.eng: one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.97:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
an4.97:2.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit themselves, but not others?

an4.97:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañca dhammānaṃ atthūpaparikkhī hoti atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya, dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti;
an4.97:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings. They readily memorize the teachings they’ve heard. They examine the meaning of teachings they’ve memorized. Understanding the meaning and the teaching, they practice in line with the teaching.

an4.97:2.3.pli: no ca kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, no ca sandassako hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
an4.97:2.3.eng: But they’re not a good speaker and do not enunciate well. Their voice isn’t polished, clear, articulate, and doesn’t express the meaning. They don’t educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire their spiritual companions.

an4.97:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.97:2.4.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit themselves, but not others.

an4.97:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya?
an4.97:3.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit others, but not themselves?

an4.97:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na heva kho khippanisantī hoti kusalesu dhammesu, no ca sutānaṃ dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, no ca dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthūpaparikkhī hoti, no ca atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti;
an4.97:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings. …

an4.97:3.3.pli: kalyāṇavāco ca hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, sandassako ca hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ.

an4.97:3.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
an4.97:3.4.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit others, but not themselves.

an4.97:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
an4.97:4.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?

an4.97:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo na heva kho khippanisantī hoti kusalesu dhammesu, no ca sutānaṃ dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, no ca dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthūpaparikkhī hoti, no ca atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti;
an4.97:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is not quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings. …

an4.97:4.3.pli: no ca kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, no ca sandassako hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
an4.97:4.3.eng: Nor are they a good speaker. …

an4.97:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.97:4.4.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.

an4.97:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca?
an4.97:5.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit both themselves and others?

an4.97:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañca dhammānaṃ atthūpaparikkhī hoti atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya, dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti;
an4.97:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings. …

an4.97:5.3.pli: kalyāṇavāco ca hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, sandassako ca hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ.

an4.97:5.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca.
an4.97:5.4.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.97:5.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.97:5.5.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.99:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.99:1.3.eng: One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;

an4.99:1.4.eng: one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;

an4.99:1.5.eng: one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and

an4.99:1.6.eng: one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.99:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
an4.99:2.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit themselves, but not others?

an4.99:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
an4.99:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. But they don’t encourage others to do the same.

an4.99:2.3.pli: attanā adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:2.4.pli: attanā kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:2.5.pli: attanā musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:2.6.pli: attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.

an4.99:2.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.99:2.7.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit themselves, but not others.

an4.99:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya?
an4.99:3.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit others, but not themselves?

an4.99:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
an4.99:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. But they encourage others to not do these things.

an4.99:3.3.pli: attanā adinnādānā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:3.4.pli: attanā kāmesumicchācārā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:3.5.pli: attanā musāvādā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.99:3.6.pli: attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭivirato hoti, paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.

an4.99:3.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
an4.99:3.7.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit others, but not themselves.

an4.99:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya?
an4.99:4.1.eng: And how does a person practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?

an4.99:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā pāṇātipātā appaṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭivirato hoti, no paraṃ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
an4.99:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual kills, etc. … and doesn’t encourage others to not do these things.

an4.99:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
an4.99:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.

an4.99:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca?
an4.99:5.1.eng: And how does an individual practice to benefit both themselves and others?

an4.99:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti, parañca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.
an4.99:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t kill, etc. … and encourages others to do the same.

an4.99:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca.
an4.99:5.3.eng: That’s how an individual practices to benefit both themselves and others.

an4.99:5.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.99:5.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”
